questions.question: What is the chemical formula of the porous magnet discussed in the paper?
questions.answer: [Fe3(HCOO)6]

questions.question: What method was used to prepare the [Fe3(HCOO)6] compound?
questions.answer: Solution-chemistry method

questions.question: What is the maximum thermal stability temperature of the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework in air?
Does the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework exhibit permanent porosity?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: What types of guests can the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework take up?
questions.answer: Both polar and non-polar guests of different sizes

questions.question: What is the main host-guest interaction in the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework?
questions.answer: Weak hydrogen-bonding

questions.question: Is the magnetic ordering in [Fe3(HCOO)6] modulated by guests?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: What is the Curie temperature range for the guest-inclusion compounds of [Fe3(HCOO)6]?
What kind of magnetic structure is proposed for the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework?
questions.answer: Noncollinear spins due to magnetic competition and geometrical frustration

questions.question: Does the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework show a guest-dependent critical temperature?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: What is the effect of guest inclusion on the magnetic properties of [Fe3(HCOO)6]?
questions.answer: Guest inclusion changes the strength of magnetic couplings, modulating the magnetic properties.

questions.question: What is the role of host-guest hydrogen bonds in the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework?
questions.answer: They provide stability and modulate magnetic properties.

questions.question: Can the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework adsorb H2 and N2 gases?
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: What is the significance of the canting angle in the magnetic structure of [Fe3(HCOO)6]?
questions.answer: It indicates the degree of noncollinearity in the spins due to various magnetic interactions.

questions.question: Is the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework considered for use as H2 storage material?
questions.answer: Yes, but it is still below the recommended capacity for application.

questions.question: What future studies are planned for the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework?
questions.answer: Neutron-scattering study, DFT calculations, exploring more guests, and creating multifunctional materials.

questions.question: What is the role of geometrical frustration in the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework?
questions.answer: It contributes to the noncollinear magnetic structure.

questions.question: Does the [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework undergo a structural phase transition upon desolvation?
questions.answer: No, it maintains its crystallinity and permanent porosity.

questions.question: What analytical method was used to confirm the phase of the [Ni3(HCOO)6] framework?
questions.answer: Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD)

questions.question: What is the significance of the study on [Fe3(HCOO)6] framework?
questions.answer: It demonstrates the potential for creating multifunctional porous magnetic materials with guest-dependent properties.
